executive_summary: The Commercial Construction Insurance industry dedicates resources and capital to underwrite risks in commercial construction. The industry is an indispensable part of risk management in commercial construction. Most commercial construction premiums are obtained through renewing policies relating to existing risks. Many construction companies view policies as inelastic, although some may choose to decrease consumption of insurance policies should premium prices climb. Over the past five years, revenue has grown at a CAGR of 2.3% to $50.3 billion, including and expected jump of 5.2% in 2024. Profit is expected to climb to 14.1% of revenue in 2024 from 13.3% in 2019.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While all commercial construction companies must have a variety of lines of insurance to legally conduct business, operators in the Commercial Construction Insurance industry have endured an increase in competition over the five years to 2024. Specifically, increased competition has come from providers of business insurance who can afford a basket of insurance lines as opposed to the more customized version provided by operators.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic's Effect on the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus) materially affected demand for industry operators' services in 2020. As commercial construction projects were halted and unemployment rapidly rose, demand for insurance provided by operators increased as insurance demand is generally inelastic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry Profitability Remains Strong Over the Past Five Years
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Furthermore, demand for industry services has climbed following the pandemic as business sentiment and private investment in manufacturing structures has increased over the past five years. Demand for operators' services increased during the period, in large part because of climbing corporate profit and business sentiment. Despite the adverse effects of the pandemic on the value of private nonresidential construction and private investment in manufacturing structures in 2020, industry profit jumped over the past five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increased Demand for Commercial Construction Will Boost Industry Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the negative effects of the pandemic surrounding private nonresidential and private investment in manufacturing structures dissipate, demand for services provided by operators is expected to continue climbing over the next five years. Corporate profit is forecast to rise, enabling businesses to expand their operations. In addition, as corporate profit rises alongside an uptick in economic activity, new businesses will also open up.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Profit Margins Slowly Increase During the Period
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: An uptick in demand for industry operators' services over the five years to 2029 is expected to benefit profitability during the period as well. As more commercial construction projects begin, the need for more insurance coverage, ranging from workers' compensation to professional liability insurance provided by operators in this industry will also increase. However, with more construction projects beginning during the period, there can also be an expected increase in the number of policy filing claims, which will slightly stymie industry profitability.

industry_definition: This industry includes companies that dedicate resources, marketing and capital to underwrite risks in the Construction sector (IBISWorld report 23). It excludes all types of commercial construction bonding, including fidelity and surety bonds.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Construction companies with less than 50 employees comprise the largest market, accounting for more than one-half of industry revenue.
Construction companies with between 50 and 500 employees account for over one-quarter of industry revenue.
Construction companies with more than 500 employees require industry services because of the large projects these companies are able to take on.

products_and_services.product_description: Workers' compensation comprises the largest segment of the industry. Workers' compensation covers medical costs related to injuries and illnesses suffered on the job.
General liability insurance covers various risks that may arise on the construction job site.
Commercial auto liability comprises the second-largest segment in the industry.
The property and inland marine segment insures physical property owned by a construction company.
The professional liability segment protects construction professionals from any mistakes or errors when offering services.
